chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ramon T Olvera Gonzalez was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail to be applied to fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 5/01/2016 or penalty of 11 days Huber for non-payment.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha City Police Department.  Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 6:00 p.m. on 3/11/2016.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Huber emailed regarding report time today.

Defendant Ramon T Olvera Gonzalez in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1.  
20 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit -  0 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 6:00 p.m. today.  
FINE:  $1429.00 bail to be applied
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department.
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:    to be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing 5/1/2016.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 11 days in Huber 
DL REVOCATION:  14 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 14 months.
AODA Assessment and follow through
